key_points: House Intelligence Committee seeks information on CIA's alleged plots to target WikiLeaks and Julian Assange.
The inquiry follows a Yahoo News report detailing plans to kidnap Assange and deep divisions within the Trump administration about this approach.
Democratic Rep. Adam Schiff, the committee chairman, stated he was not briefed about these plans in 2017.
The committee has reached out to the CIA and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) for information.
ACLU and over 20 other groups have urged Attorney General Merrick Garland to drop Assange's prosecution based on these revelations.
Assange's lawyers plan to use the CIA's alleged misconduct to argue against his extradition from the UK to the US.
Former CIA Director Mike Pompeo reportedly pushed for aggressive measures against WikiLeaks, including considering assassination.
White House lawyers reportedly vetoed the kidnapping plan, but other operations targeting WikiLeaks went ahead.
Pompeo acknowledged some truth in the Yahoo News story but denied any illegal plans to assassinate Assange.
The report has sparked outrage and calls for transparency and accountability.
spokespersons: Democratic Rep. Adam Schiff (Chairman, House Intelligence Committee)
